page.title: 01HEADLINE INF.BEULAH - GARTH
page.content:
A very rural area with the small villages of Garth & Beulah as popul- ation centres.Character of villages is slowly being lost as young people grav -itate to market town of Builth. Homes are becoming holiday cottages.New people enter the area from England, many adjust well and join in community life. These changes more apparent in Beulah. Both villages now have pavements and street lighting, because of traffic on A483.Much heavy goods traffic from North England to South Wales,also considerable holiday traffic to South and West Wales,and market and forestry lorries. The farms are prosperous, mainly worked by young people and the new school at Garth is full to capacity. A law abiding community policed from Builth Wells .
l
